name: Benthic bycatch data from non-native Crepidula fornicata dredge surveys in Belfast Lough from 2013-2017
description: This dataset contains information on the presence and absence of bycaught infaunalspecies from Crepidula fornicatasurveys in BelfastLough from 2013 to 2017 on boardtheFisheries Protection Vessel,BanrÃ­on Uladh (renamed in 2016 toQueen of Ulster).The surveys were carried out each year in lateSeptember and early October (each over 2 days of surveying). It is important to note that this dataset containsbycatch information and thiswas not the key aim of thesurvey. The C.fornicatasurvey is carried out to routinely monitor theextent of the breedingpopulation of C.fornicata (non-native in Northern Ireland) to enable policies to be put in place to minimise the spread of non-native fauna. In the years 2013-2015, a small oysterdredge was used to collect samples, in 2016 and 2017 a smallAFBInaturalist dredge was used. In total over the 4 years, 278samples were collected for identification & analysis. The most frequently recorded species was the gastropod Philine aperta.
